as are positive rights.
And if they "stomping LGBT rights" extends beyond religions not having to marry them or anything (right of association) then I would argue that is the ideal situation.
They disassociate from gays, and gays from them.
And ultimately both groups get what they want and whoever is right wins out in the end, democratically.

as are positive rights.
And if they "stomping LGBT rights" extends beyond religions not having to marry them or anything (right of association) then I would argue that is the ideal situation.[/bq]
Nope; it extends to any workforce rights.  What I mean by this is that this so called "ideal situation" would be where companies are allowed to fire employees simply for being gay or where you can do "this":http://www.keloland.com/newsdetail.cfm/yankton-teen-alleges-discrimination-from-name-tag/?id=166267 to your workers.
